noun.description: A hard siliceous or calcareous deposit precipitated from mineral springs.
Solid material which has been sintered, especially a mixture of iron ore and other materials prepared for smelting.
examples: typical blast-furnace burdens are 80% sinter, 20% ore

verb.description: Make (a powdered material) coalesce into a solid or porous mass by heating it (and usually also compressing it) without liquefaction.
examples: when the moisture is removed from the slurry the powder compact is sintered
metal powders sinter together under pressure

origin: Late 18th century (as a noun): from German Sinter; compare with cinder.
